property.name: http.content.limit
property.description: The length limit for downloaded content using the http:// protocol, in bytes. If this value is nonnegative (>=0), content longer than it will be truncated; otherwise, no truncation at all. Do not confuse this setting with the file.content.limit setting.

property.name: plugin.includes
property.description: Regular expression naming plugin directory names to include.

property.name: db.ignore.internal.links
property.description: If true, when adding new links to a page, links from the same host are ignored. We want to gather all data from a single wikipedia host.

property.name: db.ignore.external.links
property.description: If true, outlinks leading from a page to external hosts will be ignored. We don't want to follow any links to external domains.

property.name: db.max.outlinks.per.page
property.description: The maximum number of outlinks that we'll process for a page. Process all outlinks.

property.name: parser.html.nodes.exclude.mode
property.description: Mode for excluding HTML Nodes: empty for no excludes (default behavior), blacklist for excluding the nodes listed and whitelist for allowing only the nodes listed. Choose only one of these three values and set the nodes list in the parser.html.NodesList property.

property.name: parser.html.nodes.exclude.list
property.description: A list of nodes by "|". Use this to tell the HTML parser to ignore (blacklist), or allow (whitelist) only certain nodes. Each node has three elements: the first one is the tag name, the second one the attribute name, the third one the value of the attribute. Note that this property is ignored if the exclude mode is not set (default behavior).

property.name: parser.html.nodes.select.copy
property.description: optional property (default empty) to select unique nodes which we would like the parser filter to extract text from. The node html tag can be provided in "tag_name;id_name;id_value". Multiple unique tags and their respective fields are supported, simply add the divider "|" between tags. The tags text will be placed in an autogenerated tag, the name is just the concatenated tag attributes.
